articles.author: Bart Meijer
articles.description: Israel will face accusations of breaking international law by refusing to let aid into the Gaza Strip when dozens of nations present arguments at the International Court of Justice during a week of hearings starting in The Hague on Monday.
articles.title: Israel's Gaza aid blockade contested in World Court hearings

articles.author: Promit Mukherjee, Rod Nickel
articles.description: Canadians go to the polls after an election campaign in which U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs and musings about annexing Canada became the central issue.
articles.title: Canadians vote in election dominated by concerns about Trump

articles.author: Fayaz Bukhari, Shivam Patel
articles.description: India said on Monday it had responded to 'unprovoked' firing from Pakistan along the de facto border for the fourth consecutive night, as it deepens its search for militants in the region following last week's deadly attack on tourists in Kashmir.
articles.title: India, Pakistan exchange small arms fire across Kashmir border for fourth night

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Monday it was waiting for a signal from Ukraine regarding Kyiv's willingness to hold direct negotiations to end the war, but said it did not so far see any signs of movement.
articles.title: Russia says signal for start of direct peace talks should come from Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vancouver police said on Sunday said that a number of people had been killed and multiple others were injured after a driver drove into a crowd at street festival in the western Canadian city.
articles.title: Multiple dead after vehicle drives into crowd at Vancouver street festival, police say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea confirmed for the first time on Monday it has deployed troops to fight for Russia in the war with Ukraine under the order of leader Kim Jong Un and made an important contribution for the liberation of Russian territory occupied by Ukraine, state media reported on Monday.
articles.title: North Korea confirms troop deployment to Russia for first time in KCNA report

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The South Korean city of Daegu ordered on Monday more than 1,200 residents to evacuate after strong winds whipped up a wildfire and prompted the closure of a highway in the area due to concerns about the blaze.
articles.title: South Korean city orders more than 1,200 residents to evacuate due to wildfire

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: For the past year-and-a-half, allegations of sexual misconduct against rapper Sean Diddy Combs have attracted widespread media attention, including several documentaries and podcasts, sullying the reputation of the mogul once known for his rags-to-riches life story and for elevating hip-hop in American culture.
articles.title: How will the jury be chosen for Sean 'Diddy' Combs' sex trafficking trial?

articles.author: Ahmed Kingimi
articles.description: Suspected Islamist miltants killed at least 22 people and wounded several others in two separate attacks over the weekend in northeastern Nigeria, residents and police said, the latest incidents in a region plagued by armed violence.
articles.title: At least 22 killed in weekend attacks in Nigeria's northeast

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spanish power grid operator Red Electrica said it was working with energy companies to restore power after large parts of Spain and Portugal were hit by a power outage on Monday.
articles.title: Large parts of Spain and Portugal hit by power outage
